isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 MODEL - CAB ACCESSORIES - OPERATION - Horn

svcproc.title: Horn
svcproc.para: With the key switch in the on or off position, power is supplied to (B1) battery stud, circuits 14K and 14AM, 15A fuse F5-C, and circuit 85 to the horn relay (463-R7) contacts. From the relay contacts and circuit 85, power is supplied to the relay coil by a jumper 85A. When the horn button is depressed, a ground path is provided to the horn relay by way of circuit 85C, horn button connector (N/L), circuit 85A, connector (N/L), a black wire, connector (N/L), a black wire, steering wheel slip ring, a black wire, and the horn button to cab ground. Thus the horn relay will become energized and power will flow through the relay contacts, and circuit 85B to the horn and connector (214). The ground path for the horn is through circuits 85-G and 11-GI to ground stud (429).
